sn3.5:1.2: Seated to one side, King Pasenadi said to the Buddha,
sn3.5:1.3: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.
sn3.5:1.4: ‘Who are those who protect themselves? And who are those who don’t protect themselves?’
sn3.5:1.6: ‘Those who do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind
sn3.5:1.8: Even if they’re protected by a company of elephants, cavalry, chariots, or infantry,
sn3.5:1.11: Because such protection is exterior, not interior.
sn3.5:1.12: That’s why they don’t protect themselves.
sn3.5:1.13: Those who do good things by way of body, speech, and mind
sn3.5:1.15: Even if they’re not protected by a company of elephants, cavalry, chariots, or infantry,
sn3.5:1.18: Because such protection is interior, not exterior.
sn3.5:1.19: That’s why they do protect themselves.’”
sn3.5:2.1: “That’s so true, great king! That’s so true!” said the Buddha. And he repeated the king’s statement, adding:
